bugs.title: CVE-2022-23134 zabbix: Possible view of the setup pages by unauthenticated users if config file already exists [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-23134 zabbix: Possible view of the setup pages by unauthenticated users if config file already exists [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-23134 zabbix: Possible view of the setup pages by unauthenticated users if config file already exists

long_desc.thetext:
After the initial setup process, some steps of setup.php file are reachable not only by super-administrators, but by unauthenticated users as well. Malicious actor can pass step checks and potentially change the configuration of Zabbix Frontend.

References:

https://support.zabbix.com/browse/ZBX-20384

Created zabbix tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2040746]


Created zabbix40 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2040747]


Created zabbix50 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2040748]

bugs.title: CVE-2022-23132 zabbix: Incorrect permissions of [/var/run/zabbix] forces dac_override [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-23132 zabbix: Incorrect permissions of [/var/run/zabbix] forces dac_override [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-23132 zabbix: Incorrect permissions of [/var/run/zabbix] forces dac_override

long_desc.thetext:
During Zabbix installation from RPM, DAC_OVERRIDE SELinux capability is in use to access PID files in [/var/run/zabbix] folder. In this case, Zabbix Proxy or Server processes can bypass file read, write and execute permissions check on the file system level

References:

https://support.zabbix.com/browse/ZBX-20341

Created zabbix tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2040755]


Created zabbix40 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2040756]


Created zabbix50 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2040757]

bugs.title: CVE-2022-23133 zabbix: Stored XSS in host groups configuration window in Zabbix Frontend [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-23133 zabbix: Stored XSS in host groups configuration window in Zabbix Frontend [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-23133 zabbix: Stored XSS in host groups configuration window in Zabbix Frontend

long_desc.thetext:
An authenticated user can create a hosts group from the configuration with XSS payload, which will be available for other users. When XSS is stored by an authenticated malicious actor and other users try to search for groups during new host creation, the XSS payload will fire and the actor can steal session cookies and perform session hijacking to impersonate users or take over their accounts.

References:

https://support.zabbix.com/browse/ZBX-20388

Created zabbix tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2040759]


Created zabbix40 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2040760]


Created zabbix50 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2040761]
